alert.note: Alert for Glades; Hendry (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 15 at 7:30PM EST by NWS Miami
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Hendry and southwestern Glades Counties through 800 PM EST... At 730 PM EST, National Weather Service meteorologists were tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a landspout over Muse, or near Labelle, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts and winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Labelle, Port La Belle, Ortona, and Muse. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: These winds can down small tree limbs and branches, and blow around unsecured small objects. Seek shelter in a safe building until the storm passes. This activity was also developing in an environment favorable for the formation of funnel clouds. Stay tuned to NOAA weather radio and local media for additional updates and possible warnings. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
